comments.author: Cool She

comments.text:
+Ima Gimmegibbey Absolutely!  Mixing requires a Really Good ear!  You 
destroy your ears & you might just as well Forget mixing music.  There are 
certain frequencies you may not be able to hear, which will result in a mix 
that sounds like absolute El Crapola !  But just always remember to take 
care of the old hearing appendages! haha.  Steve
comments.author: STEVE SIMMS

comments.text:
+STEVE SIMMS That's interesting. I hope their guitarist stays for the next 
album (which they announced to be released in 2015).

I've experienced tinnitus as well. It comes and goes, especially with 
concerts, playing music and listening to loud music with headphones. But I 
realize I've always had ear problems (even before playing music) so I've 
been a lot more cautious when MIXING music, because that requires a lot of 
attention.
comments.author: Fed Up Fingers

comments.text:
Heard something yesterday about Coldplay's Guitarist.  He said he's damaged 
his hearing because of years of playing without ear plugs.  He has, I 
Think, tinitus, (Not sure how to spell it) It's a constant ringing in the 
ears when it's quite.  Said he wished he had used hearing protection.  I've 
stood in front of walls of Marshall stacks for years to, but thank God it 
hasnt happened with me.  But I Did start using ear plugs a few years ago 
because of an ear injury.  My wife fired a .44 magnum handgun about 6 
inches from my right ear accidentally & there was an Instant high pitched 
hum. It lasted for weeks & I had to wear ear plugs with the band because 
anything loud was painful.  But suddenly , one night while playing with the 
band, it just Stopped hurting after I hit a really high, loud note in a 
solo, & it was FINE!!!  Strange!  Its been OK since that time.  But I still 
kept wearing the ear plugs & found that on stage, it made it actually 
Easier to hear everything.  It cuts out a lot of the noise & stray 
frequencies & you can hear Just what you need to hear.
comments.author: STEVE SIMMS

Call it magic, call it true

Want anybody else but you

No I don't, it's true
I don't, no, I don't, no, I don't, no, I don't
Want anybody else but you
Ooh ooh ooh
Call it magic, cut me into two
And with all your magic, I disappear from view
And I can't get over, can't get over you
Still, I call it magic, such a precious truth
And I don't, and I don't, and I don't, and I don't
No I don't, it's true
I don't, no, I don't, no, I don't, no, I don't
Want anybody else but you
I don't, no, I don't, no, I don't, no, I don't
No I don't, it's true
I don't, no, I don't, no, I don't, no, I don't
Want anybody else but you
Wanna fall, I fall so far
I wanna fall, fall so hard
And I call it magic
And I call it true
Call it magic
Ooh ooh ooh
Ooh ooh ooh
Ooh ooh ooh
Ooh ooh ooh
And if you were to ask me
After all that we've been through
"Still believe in magic?"
Well yes, I do
Oh yes, I do
Oh yes, I do
Oh yes, I do
Of course I do﻿
